question: "I know. Can't tow this crate fast enough! We gotta ditch it!"
answer: "Can't, the core is still good. And they've got 'The One.'"

question: "Oooh, our savior. Hed better be worth it."
answer: "Shut up and make the exit. Hold on!" "Woo-hoooh!"

question: "I'll have to take that one down now. Cypher..."
answer: "Who is this guy?"

question: "Who?" "That was... I... forgot his name."
answer: "What happened to him?" "Was he like me?"

question: "Not you, though. Like you. There have been others, Neo."
answer: "No. I've never been a big sleeper."

question: "I know. I used to watch you hacking without sleeping for days."
answer: "How many 'ones' have there been?"

question: "That's not the point." "You are him. Youre mine."
answer: "But what does it mean, to be The One?"

question: "I don't know, Neo. Our mission was to find you."
answer: "So, now what?"

question: "In the flesh, so to speak."
answer: "Welcome to the real world, Neo. I'm glad you're here."

question: "What do you think, Dujour? Should we take him with us?"
answer: "Definitely."

question: "So, how do you like having your own command?"
answer: "Its good. But trying. The responsibility..."

question: "You must be both mother and father to your crew."
answer: "Who will you be now? The mother, or the father?"

question: "Its muscle memory, Neo. Think of the space bar and your thumbs nail it. Because your thumbs have hit the space bar millions of times. But think about reverse ka, and your fingers dont hit automatically hit the reverse key and the ka key in one shot."
answer: "Where did these symbols come from, anyway?"

question: "Most of it is from the old Japanese. Its Katakana. See, the machines arent binary. No zero and one. Theyre quantum-based, so instead of an open-close base of zero or one, open or closed, they use all numbers between zero and one."
answer: "All numbers between zero and one. That could be an infinite number of numbers."

question: "Not could be, it is."
answer: "Holy shit. How many calculations per second?"

question: "How many CPS? Well, thats kind of hard to estimate. Put it this way
answer: "OK. At last count that was what, a gazillion, right? Two gazillion?"

question: "Well, its up there. In any case, the number of calculations per second the Matrix can perform is greater than the estimated number of particles in the known universe."
answer: "Woah."

question: "OK. Thats why it looks like reality. They have the computing power to create entire worlds."
answer: "Right."

question: "So, if we hack into the Matrix, why cant we just change the code while were at it?"
answer: "No, no. See, its not that simple. The machines, the programs that code, create, and maintain the Matrix, the agents, they are code. There are different types of agents, many work unseen with no interaction in the matrix. Then, there are the enforcers, the ones we know all too well."

question: "Right."
answer: "Well, my point is, the machines code and recode the Matrix by pure will. Interaction with the Matrix, the physical act of being there, by default, allows people to change their environment - the Matrix. They move objects, make sound, affect cause."

question: "Boo."
answer: "Dont lose your balance."

question: "It doesnt matter if I do."
answer: "So, you can fly."

question: "Yes."
answer: "Do you think I can?"

question: "I think you can do anything you want, if you believe."
answer: "Like you?"

question: "I dont know. I dont know exactly what I can do."
answer: "Will you teach me to fly?"

question: "I dont know if I can."
answer: "Free your mind of doubt." "In this construct program, the ground can kill."

question: "I wont let you fall. Ever." "Its not real, Trinity. Youre not standing there. Step out. I can do it. You can, too."
answer: "Shit."

question: "Whoops." "Grab me!" "Grab on to me!" "What the hell were you doing?"
answer: "Showing you, Neo."

question: "Showing me what? You nearly gave me a heart attack."
answer: "I want you to know how much faith I have in you."

question: "Oh. And this requires acts of insanity?" "Only when Im plugged in." "What?"
answer: "Its not you. Just, not here." "Theyre watching us, you big dope. Do you know how horny computer geeks get?"

question: "We cant defeat them. You saw what happened." "We have a backup copy of Agent Smith..." "A backup is not good enough. We need to upgrade ourselves to meet the new threat."
answer: "Hes being rebuilt. But I have an alternate plan. Why fight the humans, when we can let them fight for us?"

question: "The terrorists have learned to bend our reality in ways we cannot. This was the cause of our defeat."
answer: "Mr. Thomas J. Anderson is not unique. Over the decades, many humans have developed... techniques for manipulating the Matrix. Techniques too primitive for us to understand. Most never realize their potential, but all the ones weve noticed exhibiting these talents are recorded here."

question: "Do you have anyone in mind?"
answer: "Gregory Lowfield. He exhibits the traits we saw in Mr. Anderson." "Youve been recreated."

question: "Holy shit. Drunk ass punks."
answer: "Oh boy. Stop, stop, lets have some fun."

question: "Holy shit!" "What the hell are you doing?"
answer: "Well tell you when to stop, little man. Not the other way around."

question: "Fuck."
answer: "Dont try anything stupid, man. I gotta bead on your donut-eating ass."

question: "Whaddya want with me?"
answer: "I dont know. I just thought Id find out what you wanted without you shooting at me. So, what do you want?"

question: "Youre all under arrest."
answer: "This is your lucky day, officer. Were gonna give you a night off."

question: "This is your lucky day, officer. Were gonna give you a night off."
answer: "Drink."

question: "You never even saw us, man."
answer: "Keep the bottle."

question: "Which one do you want?"
answer: "Any one. It doesnt matter." "How do you do it, Gregory?"

question: "I dont know. Sometimes it feels like... Im reaching beyond the world."
answer: "What is it?"

question: "They found us. Cant you hear it?"
answer: "What? I dont hear anything."

question: "We can only rebel so long. We can only push until they will hit back."
answer: "They? The Men in Black?"

question: "Fuck! Get to the bikes." "Wake up! Get on your bikes and fucking ride!"
answer: "Theyre gone!"

question: "Holy shit."
answer: "What? Tell me you got signal."

question: "No fucking shit I got signal. Dude, theyre changing it."
answer: "Are you using the right pulse wave?"

question: "Shut the fuck up and get back here."
answer: "Oh my God. What are they - "

question: "Theyre changing the Matrix."
answer: "Call Morpheus."

question: "Im here."
answer: "Sir, you gotta get down here."

question: "Proximity alarm?"
answer: "The Matrix, sir. The coding is going nuts."

question: "Be right there." "It sounds bad. Theyre readjusting quicker than we thought."
answer: "Already?"

question: "It appears that they are learning their lessons." "Tell Neo? About his predecessors, I suppose?" "He is the -"
answer: "Six came before him, Morpheus."

question: "To me, none came before him. The Oracle told me I would find the one. It is prophecy. You havent seen what he can do."
answer: "What if they toughen the Matrix code, like last time?"

question: "But theyre altering the code already. I cant even read it yet."
answer: "We have our mission, but its up to us to interperate how well do it."

question: "Morpheus, theres more ice in front of that mainframe than there is in Antarctica. Well never cut through it all."
answer: "You havent seen The One in action." "Can you hack in?"

question: "Getting you in is no problem. Maintaining the input/output and helping you is the problem. Thats how they killed savior number four, if I remember right. They cut the signal and trapped him in there."
answer: "We dont speak of the past." "Morning. Niobe, wake the rest of the crew. Razor, whats the ETA for getting us in there?"

question: "I dunno. Just gimme an hour, Ill probably have caught up to them."
answer: "Come with me."

question: "Oh my God. Its... The Man." "What for?" "Its too late. Were dead."
answer: "Do you want to live?"

question: "What for?"
answer: "A better life for all. Life for her. And for you, a chance for revenge." "Interested?"

question: "This cant be real."
answer: "You this, dont you?"

question: "Yes."
answer: "Will you help us?"

question: "Anything." "Who the fuck are you?"
answer: "Im nobody. A Smith. Whats more important, is you. We need you, Gregory."

question: "First you try to kill me. Now you need me."
answer: "Two years ago, Gregory, your parents were killed in a terrorist attack in the heart of the city."

question: "So what?"
answer: "The terrorists were led by a certain individual."

question: "I know who it was."
answer: "We need you to kill him."

question: "What a bunch of bullshit. The whole government cant kill him, so how can I?"
answer: "No one in the government can do what you can."

question: "Fuck you."
answer: "I believe we have a deal."

question: "What are you gonna do, little man? You looking for a trip to the fucking hospital? Fuck with me and youll be looking for some plastic surgery, you - " "No man can beat me."
answer: "Bring it on, pussy."

question: "Mother fucker, what the fu -?"
answer: "Ready to change your mind?" "I can teach you to beat me, you know." "Help us, and both you and her will be free afterward." "You know it, dont you? That theres more to your world than what you can see, what you can rationally explain?"

question: "Yeah."
answer: "Im going to teach you how to use the powers you cant even imagine. But first, you need to learn to fight."

question: "Were deep in their territory."
answer: "I see that."

question: "Are you rested?"
answer: "Yes."

question: "You know now, that you had predecessors."
answer: "Yes. Ive heard things."

question: "What types of things?"
answer: "That there were others, like me, who you thought were going to be special. But they ended up dead."

question: "Its true. There were others. And I didnt tell you right away. Because you were not ready." "Does this anger you?"
answer: "I dont know yet. So much has happened so fast, that I cant decide whether or not Im angry, or dissappointed, or even if I should be."

question: "You shouldnt be, Neo. You are the key in the Oracles prophecy. Everything forseen to come to pass, has, except one thing."
answer: "What?"

question: "The destruction of The Matrix." "Your coming was heralded, and it is my destiny to prepare the world for you, and to baptize you by fire. But from here on out, no one knows."
answer: "Can we ask The Oracle."

question: "Not in this life." "No one has heard from her or her priestesses since the day Cypher turned on us."
answer: "But she must have known, if they came to her."

question: "Perhaps she did."
answer: "I cant believe it. I dont know, Morpheus, if Im prepared for this war. Im not a soldier. How, how are we going to win?"

question: "Remember, when I told you, that Ill show you how deep the rabbit hole goes?"
answer: "Yes."

question: "Fuck."
answer: "Pain is only weakness leaving your body. When you are sufficiently strong, you will feel no pain."

question: "Tell me about what is happening. Whats wrong with the world?"
answer: "Get up and fight." "The world is not for you."

question: "What do you mean?"
answer: "Youre not human, Gregory. Thats why you dont fit in. Thats why you have certain powers."

question: "What, am I from planet Krypton?"
answer: "Not quite. But as humans continue to evolve, some are developing capabilities beyond those of the average man. Reality-altering abilities. I have them. Others in the Agency have them. And you have them, too. Were all that stands between law and order, and a terrorist dictatorship lead by the one called Morpheus." "We need you to stop the terror. We need you to save our world." "We need you, because youre better than me. Now push past your abilities. You can turn you imagination into reality. See your hands striking me, see yourself overcoming me. Fight, boy!"

question: "Where is she?"
answer: "Here." "She doesnt remember our encounter. Shes fine. Dont worry."

question: "Keep your foot on the gas. Heal thyself."
answer: "Any luck?"

question: "None. Theyve killed city-wide comms."
answer: "Then the agents are out of touch with each other."

question: "They cant track us, but that gives them more time to destroy our exits, and find the Neb. Well try the desert. Communications might be working there still."
answer: "What about Niobe?"

question: "What the fuck just happened?"
answer: "We need you, Gregory. Will you help us stop this?"

question: "I can stop this?"
answer: "Yes."

question: "Alright. But how can I fight him?"
answer: "I will give you the power you need."

question: "I know."
answer: "So, why dont you take it all down?"

question: "The Matrix?"
answer: "Yes."

question: "I can. But if I destroy the Matrix, everyone within it will die."
answer: "I take it the great Morpheus failed to mention this?"

question: "How many people are in it?"
answer: "Six and a half billion."

question: "Operator."
answer: "Good to hear youre still there."

question: "Jesus, you too. Where the fuck are you?"
answer: "About two hundred miles east of the city, on highway 315. We need an exit."

question: "Coming up on your left, ten miles, a rest stop."
answer: "I dont remember an exit there."

question: "Gimme five minutes."
answer: "Out."

question: "So, you really dont have any idea how you got here?"
answer: "No. I only remember being on the bike."

question: "Yeah, you took a pretty good knock on the head. Do you know how we got this place?"
answer: "Duh. We broke in. We dont own a penthouse."

question: "What if I said we did?"
answer: "Id say youre insane."

question: "Yes, there is a problem. The Matrix exists."
answer: "I know. Im sorry."

question: "And the problem is..."
answer: "Uh, its impossible. If the Matrix is destroyed, the people within the system will die. They will all die. There has to be a different way." "Morpheus? Did you know this?"

question: "I didnt say things would be easy, Neo."
answer: "No."
